A little goes a long way ‚Äî This is my most favorite conditioner out there. I have issues trying to find conditioners that don't weight my hair down or make it sticky or fluffy and dry. This is by far the best one I've found. I have very dry, thick, wavy hair. I know people are complaining about the alcohol that didn't used to be in this hair conditioner, but that doesn't effect my hair at all. Infact it improves mine. The reason why I like it so much is because it really smoothed and hydrates the heck out of my hair. I put it on for 10-15 minutes in my shower and then rinse it. It makes my hair so smoothe and silky feeling. Also, the scent us yummy smelling, I don't know why no one likes it. My husband especially loves it. üòâ

Large, stiff, awkward to hold and overstuffed. ‚Äî I know that loofahs take a while to break in, but I think this product has other issues. I'm a woman with smaller hands. This is just too oversized for me. It's difficult to hold and control. It's also overstuffed with a very convex surface, so only the center of the raised area actually touches my body. It doesn't mold itself to the surface of my skin, so I feel like I'm scrubbing in thin lines, and it doesn't really do the job in the dips and grooves a human body has because of that. It does dries quickly, even though I don't have anything to hang it off of. I'm pretty disappointed with this order and I can't recommend this product.

Very strong scent at first, but it disappears very quickly. ‚Äî I really loved the idea of this Boiess Baby Cologne "Les Enfants" in White Blossom. Not because I think it is a good idea for a baby, because boy, is it not. I actually thought it would be perfect for myself since I don't like loud fragrances. The description of the scent profile really enticed me, as I love all of the notes. I was able to try both the Lavanda and the White Blossom scents.
Both of the "Cologne" sprays smell identical to me. I can't say that I can tell them apart at all. They both have a very strong earthy, herbal, slightly floral scent that is heavily ladened with alcohol upon spraying. It stays very strong for several minutes, but then starts to dry down.
Sadly, once it dries down, the scent pretty much dissipates. If I don't spray it heavily at first, which is too much for my asthma to handle, much less any baby, the scent just goes away completely. I must spray it on me again. If I spray it on a few times over an hour or so, I can smell the ever so slightest hint of it on my clothing later, if I put my nose right on it. That is a lot of spraying for very little payoff.
I know this is meant for kids mostly, but I would think the scent would and should last longer. Sure, my grandsons will like using it, maybe or

Not bad for my 3c natural hair ‚Äî I used to use Pantene Women of Color Conditioner (or whatever it's called) back when I was relaxed and in the beginning of my natural hair journey. I ended up switching to a different conditioner that was cheaper and it actually ended up being more effective, so I haven't used Pantene probably in 2 years.

I read about the Truly Natural line and I was a little hesitant about trying it due to past experience with it not adding much moisture to my hair. I heard good things about it so I decided to give the co-wash a shot, hoping it'd be a cheaper alternative to the As I Am Coconut cowash.

I soaked my hair in the shower, used a palm sized amount, focusing on my scalp first as I usually do, then started finger detangling the rest of my hair. I'll have to admit, the slip is pretty good! This stuff really melted my strands and made finger detangling a breeze - which is most important for me in a conditioner. I also like how thick the product is. When I slathered this on each section, my hair felt coated and moisturized, but not too thick that I had a hard time rinsing it out.

Now when I rinsed it out, my hair still felt soft, but not as soft as I'd like. Also, the scent does smell good, but it's just a tiny bit overpowering, which doesn't surprise me since it's Pantene.
Needs more oil! ‚Äî I liked the product and love the smell of anything coconut, but would have liked it to be more moist - it needs more oil!

There‚Äôs a big difference. My hair is not as frizzy. And every time I comb my scalp, it just feels good and refreshing. Its thickness is great too. I love it.

Works as advertised ‚Äî Very cool spray bottle. I was tired of my wife wasting money burning through cheap throw away bottles from Target, Walmart or the Dollar Store.
Came across the extended spray bottles by accident and decided to go with this one, I believe based on other reviews.
Works as advertised and is really quite magical. It just keeps spraying, kind of like a 3 to 1 ratio, one trigger pull gets you about three sprays worth of water. Really cool.
Just recently, my 10 year old got the bright idea, she wanted cold water spritz on a hot day at practice, and decided to put this bottle - full of water - in the freezer. It was fully frozen, bottom pushed out due to ice expansion, and I left it out to thaw fully expecting to order another figuring it was wrecked. To my surprise, once thawed out, pushed the bottle back to shape, and continues to work flawlessly.
So, unexpectedly durable, takes a good freezing, totally against the directions I‚Äôm sure.

Overall a great trimmer with 1 exception ‚Äî I've been using a Norelco beard trimmer for years. I bought the first T100 which used 2 AA batteries. I've seen the improvements over the years and they have definitely added to how well the products functioned. Right off the bat I'll tell you my exception. This beard trimmer was made in China. That might not matter at all to some and you are entitled to your opinion. But it matters to me and I was slightly disappointed to see that they are not being made in Austria anymore.

Other than that, I am impressed with this trimmer. The turbo vacuum system works great. I have not had to clean my bathroom sink even once. The self-sharpening blades no longer need to be lubricated with oil. Ever though this unit is slightly bigger than my last one (T990)it is not more awkward in my hands. Even the Accu Control System's flexing guide comb is easier to clean than the last one.

I do have to recharge the battery after 2 or 3 uses but it does have a quick charge feature that takes about 1 hour. So I can't really complain about that.

I have not noticed any problems with actually trimming my beard. The 9 lockable length settings have not slipped for me as others have reported (I am currently using a number 4). I have not had any problems with trimming under my nose but I have been used to using a Norelco.

The cream does not VISIBLY reduce the appearance of a bruise. ‚Äî The cream is a tan color and when first applied it does cover the bruise for about ten seconds until it's absorbed. It is a HUGE overstatement, maybe a lie, to say it reduces the appearance of a bruise. If you want to hide a bruise, get a concealer! I've tried many things to hasten the healing time from chopped parsley, heat, messaging, arnica, a banana peel, and rubbing the bruise with a warm hard boiled egg. In my experience, the only real cure is to wait it out, usually ten days until a bruise will fade. I'm not saying heladerm doesn't help heal the bruise. It may, but this cream (I applied it at least five times a day and twice at night) doesn't make the bruise go away any faster.

Acid Mantle Cream ‚Äî I have eczema on my hands - that's how it started out. Being a mother of 2 and my hands always in water, the condition has gotten worse. When I went to the dermatologist, she said the skin on my hands has been compromised so much that it will never be the same and I will always have to deal with sensitive skin there. My hands get so irritated and inflamed that they really pain me. I can use steroids at times to get in under control, but she put me on to Acid Mantle as well. Love it. Really works and helps my skin heal and stay moisturized. When my hands are paining me, I put some on and the pain starts to go away. A-Mantle can be pretty expensive at the pharmacy, but I've found it to be reasonably priced at Amazon, and I'm sure other websites. Highly recommend for any dry skin or even Eczema.

Love How My Teeth Feel ‚Äî There was a definite learning curve for this. I‚Äôve never owned either an electric toothbrush, or a water flosser. First time out with the flosser, I got all wet. I had to Google how to use one. Apparently, it is a messy ordeal unless you‚Äôre very, very careful. After the first couple of uses, I had the same issue referenced by other reviewers, that the water pressure would randomly be very low. It seems the rubber seal that connects the tank to the inner workings of the machine does ‚Äúgrab‚Äù properly. I‚Äôve found that by taking the end of a standard toothbrush and gently pressing down on the seal before turning it on results in a machine that works normally every time. I LOVE LOVE LOVE how water flossing, combined with the electric toothbrush leave my teeth! The difference between this and just a standard toothbrush is palpable. In fact, combined with the fact that I was 25 the first time I saw a dentist, I‚Äôm surprised I haven‚Äôt rotted my teeth out at this point. It‚Äôs addictive how clean my teeth feel! Oral hygiene has never been something I think about, it was just been something I had to do. Now I actually look forward to it, just so I can run my tongue over my teeth to feel how clean they feel.

Lemony face wash üçã ‚Äî I just washed my face with this Sia C + Lemon Peel wash. It lathered nicely in my hands and on my face. It has a soft lemony scent. It rinsed well - and this is where you'll feel the difference. You know the phrase 'squeaky clean'? That's what you'll feel. There's absolutely no residue left behind. If you've used Noxema to wash your face, it has a similar effect. Because I'm prone to dry skin, I had to apply cream immediately. The label on the bottle suggests washing with this, then using a toner, followed by Vitamin C. Makes sense as your skin is stripped of everything and is ready for some TLC. I think this is an ideal wash for people with oily or combination skin. For me, this will be a great summer wash to control the shine (oil). If you're skin is dry like mine, then moisturize immediately after using.

Upon opening it, I was initially disappointed when I saw they went kinda cheap with the eye mask- it's only about half full of the gel beads. It's mostly air. Because of this, I assumed the whole kit would be cheap. But it's actually pretty nice! The packaging is great, you get a big pack of the facial cleansing wipes and five of the face masks, and it all feels great on your skin.
My skin was softer after the mask. I suggest warming it first - I tossed it in its package right into my hot bath, along with the eye gel mask. The mask can be a little drippy ( they usually are), so soaking in the bath with it on means no clean up.

You can wear this for days. ‚Äî If you're looking for a lip product that really, truly only needs to be applied once a day, this is it. This is my second LipTint from LA Splash (The other was Bellatrix/Belladonna) and both of these have stayed on my lips through 48 hours of wear until I decided to remove them. They lasted through eating, drinking, talking, sleeping, showering, exercising, and just about any other task you can expect to do throughout a day.

If you've never used an LA-Splash LipTint, the first thing you're going to say about them is that they're super drying. I've found that the drying effect is really what keeps this stuff attached to your lips until you decide to remove it. My best advice is to keep your lips in good condition before its use. When I do this, my lips don't get that cracked appearance people tend to complain about when using LA-Splash LipTints. They look more like the advertised picture. When I remove it, I do a lip scrub and put on a little more lip balm and my lips are as good as new. For the longevity you get out of this stuff, it's hard to complain.

The only downfall is that you really need to be an expert using liquid eyeliner. I am not. So practice makes perfect. Every time gets better. When applying, a magnetic 'chunk' will sometimes appear and will throw your line off. Removal is easy, but not super quick. Because of the strong hold, I have to gently apply/rub a makeup wipe over the lashes until the product is removed and lashes can be peeled off. skin care staple ‚Äî There are an overwhelming selection of products available for skin care, therefore it can be very difficult to know which products are best if you want healthy, glowing skin. Two products which are currently gaining favor among natural skin care enthusiasts are rosehip oil and argan oil. The nuts of the argan tree are predominantly harvested in Morocco. Although argan oil is a relatively new and unfamiliar beauty product in the United States, it has actually been a skin care staple for many generations of Mediterranean women.
As many people will know, rosehips are small fruits produced by a certain type of rose. Like argan oil, rosehip is very high in essential fatty acids. These have two benefits when applied to the skin.

Does a passable job ‚Äî I have long been under the impression, from the experience of others and just as a general idea, that while electric shavers can be good, they will never be able to fully complete with a manual razor. That being said, I didn't expect this device to be as good as a traditional razor. It isn't. It does ok getting most of the major scruff off and the big benefits are that it safes both money (no shaving cream needed) and you don't really have to worry about those pesky cuts. That's the big one for me. It is also easy to clean and feels very sturdy. There's nothing about it that indicates that you'd expect it to be a cheap as the price. There are a few trade-offs. It takes a little longer than a traditional shave as that you have to go over the areas a few times. The cut is decent but not as clean as a manual razor. Overall not bad but if you are looking for baby smooth skin you'll either need to look elsewhere or use this in combination with another product.

Love these towels! ‚Äî I do quite a bit of backpacking and canoe camping.
I always bring a few of these compact towels with me on my trips.

They are durable enough that you will get multiple uses out of each one. I have even washed one in my machine at home and reused it.
They are made of cotton, I think, so they are biodegradable. I don't recommend burying them in a cat hole or anything though, as they won't break down fast enough to allow that. I have used them as a TP substitute once or twice, and they are awesome for that, but I always burn them or pack them out afterwards.
I really like these towels.
They are an excellent value for the money.
Perfect for traveling, backpacking, camping, etc.
Highly recommended.

Cremo is great, but different ‚Äî I note some of the negative reviews here with interest. I am not sure that they are written in good faith, but on the assumption that they are, one complaint that I can relate to is that Cremo does not lather and that it does not shave as well as some other shaving soaps and creams. I initially had a similar reaction when I first started to use Cremo but that changed with experience, as I relate below.

I have to feel that these negative reviews are probably due to the user not knowing how to work with the product and not knowing what to expect. Cremo is not a high lathering (or even much of a low lathering) cream. If used correctly (or even incorrectly for that matter) you will definitely not get a nice white Barbasol cloud of foam on your face. What you will get is a very light, essentially transparent, coating of highly slick lubricant. And that is the other thing: with Cremo you need to use a lot (I mean a lot) of water. In fact you need to use a ratio of something like 20:1 water to product. The more water, the better, even if you think you are using so much that you are essentially washing the product off your face (you aren't). This stuff is very highly concentrated.

As stated above, I am somewhat sympathetic to the negative reviews since it took me a while to warm up to Cremo

Nice size. Easy operation. Effective curling function. üëçüëç ‚Äî Of course the first thing that the significant other noticed about the product is the pink coloring. She said it goes perfectly with her other hair/beauty products. So, already it has a head start.
It comes inside a nice, somewhat snug drawstring bag. This is useful for transporting the curling device. And, yes, the compact size makes it very sensible to pack for remote (away from home) usage. Another key aspect of the product is wireless operation. Evidence: she comments that not having to worry about wires or being close to the wall outlet is fantastic. And, not dealing with power cords means better time efficiency.
Operation is fairly easy. A long press of the power button turns it on. When you press the power button again, you advance to a feature you can alter/select, with that aspect blinking. For example, the "R" might be blinking. You use the +/- button to change it to "L" (R and L indicate the curling direction, creating right or left curls). In this manner, you can change the direction, temperature and timer. The display also shows the battery power status. When the curler device has reached proper temperature, it beeps. You can then insert a small section of hair. Curling appearance/tightness will depend on hair texture, temperature and time of treatment.
The battery capacity is rated at 5000mAh. It takes 3 - 4 hours to fully charge a depleted battery. This affords 4 - 6 hours of continuous operating time.

Nightmare to get activated! ‚Äî If you install before your old payroll runs out, too bad so sad, you lose whatever part of the year you still had. And you cannot activate without a current FULL credit card number. I didn't have the card handy that was on the current license and it hadn't expired so I didn't expect them to refuse to activate until I had a full number. So, I had to get a new CC just so I could activate the software.
Even though they were still billing the old card monthly for the extra employees. Once you give them your cc number they automatically bill you for the full Quickbooks AND the payroll next year unless you call and cancel the purchase. And then to use the retail license from Amazon when you buy it you have to call again. and if you decide to wait on the payroll part if it expires later, you have to call AGAIN. It is maddening to do this every year. You save some money but you spend time. So, if you are busy and billing time, you won't find this saves you anything and the frustration is high. Quickbooks really needs to look into automating their registration process.

AWESOME PRODUCT! EASY TO USE! NO BURNS! ‚Äî I just received this KINDOMCARES hair straightening comb today and I was so excited I could not wait to try it. The comb itself is of high quality and comes packaged very nicely. It has an on/off button and six heat settings depending on the weight, curl and thickness of your hair. My hair is color treated, slightly wavy with medium thickness so I used the middle setting (3 to 4). The device heated up in under a minute and is cool to the touch as the heating element is not exposed to the outer edge of the comb. I found that starting from the underside of my hair gave me more control than just combing it down my head. I was able to straighten my whole head in under 5 minutes. I love that I cannot burn myself which is my main complaint about hair straightening irons. Also, I was able to get my hair straight without hearing it sizzle as I did not need as much heat. I am posting picture of the device, my blown dry hair before and my straight hair afterwards. I really like this comb better than the many other methods I have tried. I did receive the KINDOMCARES ceramic heating comb at a discount or at no charge for the purpose of providing the company with my honest and unbiased feedback. I would highly recommend it to you!!!!

The only thing that holds my hair up properly ‚Äî I have long, very thick hair. My hair breaks heavy-duty ponytail holders regularly. My hair laughs at barrettes and clips. Every time I've had a professional updo for a formal event, the stylist has used multiple dozens of bobby pins to hold my hair in place. And I have never been able to do an updo myself and get it to stay in place, no matter how many bobby pins I use. My hair just spits them out, and the updo falls down. I'd even tried those Magic Grip curved plastic hairpins -- people claimed those held up long hair -- and if anything, they worked worse than regular bobby pins in my hair. (And yes, I used them right, first aiming them out of the bun and then twisting them around to tuck them into the bun.)

So I was skeptical when a friend recommended Spin Pins. I figured they would be another disappointment. But they are BRILLIANT.

It takes four Spin Pins to hold my hair in a bun (the package instructions say to use two, but they're written for people with normal amounts of hair). I literally just screw them into the bun so that they catch some of the hair that lies against my head, along with catching the bun itself. I figured out the best technique by my second try. I promise these aren't complicated to use. The instructions have pictures.

And once they're in, that bun stays

New Technology is a step back ‚Äî My old Norelco was better, more sturdy. This one is lighter - a plus - but being lighter seems to make it somewhat flimsier. Worse, despite the "improved" shaving heads with 50% more shaving surface, the shaving time takes much longer, which took me by surprise. I'm not sure why the longer shaving time, but I sense that the shavers spin slower than my old Norelco. It is quiet, which was important to me, and, ultimately, I do get a fairly close shave. The pop-up trimmer works fine and the recharging stand is convenient. I like the form-fitted case. The head opens too easily, so I'm forever cleaning up shaving stubble due to accidental openings. I cannot comment on the battery life, as it is still too new to see how economical the shaver is, however I can say that a full charge lasts me about a week (five shaves). Overall, I'm fairly satisfied, notwithstanding the above disappointments, but I cannot say I'm "wowed" by this new model over my older model.

Nice Brow Pencil But Nothing Special ‚Äî This comes in a nice outer product box. It says it‚Äôs made in Korea. There‚Äôs no ingredients or cruelty free logo on the box.

The outer packaging of the pencil is a cream color. It has gold writing on it. It looks nice. It‚Äôs lightweight. The writing on the back of the pencil is in Korean (at least I‚Äôm guessing that‚Äôs what it is since the product was made in Korea). There is English on the back that has ‚ÄúPencil‚Äù just under the cap on one end, and ‚ÄúBrush‚Äù just under the cap on the other end. So, it‚Äôs nice each side is labeled. The pencil is triangular shaped. The spoolie is the standard spoolie. It is soft, not too scratchy.

It glides onto the eyebrows easily. Very creamy. It has good pigment. It blends into the eyebrows well and doesn‚Äôt just blend away when you use the spoolie. I usually like micro tips because they give you hair like strokes. You can get pretty good hair like strokes using the tip of the triangle. Using the side you can fill the brows in quickly. The product lasts in my brows all day without fading or smearing.

Overall, I think this is a nice brow pencil. Honestly, I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs any better than my drugstore brow pencils that are cheaper. So, I wouldn‚Äôt purchase this. But, it is a nice brow pencil.

A clean house! ! ‚Äî My Mother ruined me. All my life, from birth, she powdered me. And I can't stand to bathe and just dry and put my clothes on without powder. And about 35 years ago or so my sister in law introduced me to Gold Bond. It has been a true golden bond. One that I had no idea of breaking. The only problem with it was that powder, no matter how carefully you try to apply it, seeps even to the fartherest and darkest corners of your house. Not to mention the bathroom looking like it had snowed in there...all the time. I had such a hard time my entire life just trying to stay ahead of house cleaning...dusting, cleaning up powder residue.
A lady that used to clean told me that people that powder...There was no way for them to have a perfectly clean house. That the powder drifted everywhere.
And....then I had 2 daughters that I raised to love powder too. And when all had been said and done and the kids were grown and my sister and I moved in together, we both lived in a cloud of powder! Gold Bond.... we were all hooked on Gold Bond!
Then....one day I happened to notice the spray and I thought. . .. I wonder?
I bought a can and the rest is history, as they say.
And our house is clean!
And we just moved into a new home in October so this house will never have powder in all

Thermal gel polish-YES! ‚Äî I have quite a few regular nail polishes that are thermal and I love the magic of the changing colors. I really enjoy showing people how cool it looks for the polish to change color right before their eyes! Now having the option to do this with long lasting gel polish is super exciting! I swatched these colors and was able to immediately see the color difference after being under the warm lights of the led lamp so the changing is very sensitive, which is really what you want in a thermal polish. The stickers on the tops of the bottles aren't all that color accurate BUT they do give a general idea of what the colors are so you can have an idea of what you have. I did 2 coats for each color and it's a little hard to tell but some were great with 2 coats and others really could have benefited from a third. The glitter polish is really not a pretty color at all, I kind of wish it was either just a different thermal all together or they had chose different colors for it. The blue and reddish colors were the best formulas, seeming more like regular nail polish (not as thick and much smoother application).
The set is packaged great for gift giving. If you know anyone who really likes polish this would be great for them, keeping in mind if they don't already work with gel polishes they will need not only some type

Good Idea but Bad Performance. ‚Äî I shave once every two days and decided to try M3 Power Nitro (black). It attracted my attention by innovative idea of combining regular razor with electro-vibration, thus making a hybrid.

I'm not impressed with it at all! I don't like it for several reasons. Vibration actually is mostly reflected on a handle so I felt uncomfortable because it was making my hand too shaky and I'm 26 years old and not a drinker! It doesn't cause cuts or burns but it felt really annoying to my hand while shaving and even a few minutes later!

Due to a better lubricator-strip it glides better, softer than regular Mach3 but shaving performance is about the same. Handle grip is OK but a bit worse than regular Mach3 because it doesn't have fully rubberized handle bottom. It can be used with Mach3 cartridges, I tested and shaved. While shaving I was concerned about not getting wet its battery compartment.

I would rather use it as regular Mach3 razor, with vibration turned off, but would NOT buy another! Why pay more for a "fancy" but in fact useless/annoying vibration function if regular Mach3 does practically the same, if not better, job?!

IS THIS REMY? ‚Äî It almost feels like 100% remy, which is absolutely stunning for the price and volume. For those who don't know, 100% remy is the $70plus extensions, meaning that it's real hair and stuff (which isn't necessary to get the look/feel you want). The hair length is accurate and the colors are as pictured. Even on a pixie cut, these clip-in extensions are comfortable, stay put quite well, and look/feel natural.

It's silky, the curl actually holds itself (but I don't recommend washing it), and it is NOT shiny so it looks truly real.

I will be buying multiple of these, along with hair chalk so I can make it look like my real hair. Also, to those who have a bad pixie cut - Fear not! Don't get 100% remy extensions, those are $70+ each. Glue-ins are a nightmare. Get the clip-ins that are a blend of synthetic and real, however don't fully remove it from the package unless it blends well. THEY WORK ON A PIXIE. Not "short" hair, a 1 inch pixie cut. I'm not including a photo as I only purchased one.

I have always been a magnet to any mosquitos. As in, if I step outside, every single one in a two mile radius gets the notification on their tiny phones "BUFFET!1!!!1" and they come swarming.

Unfortunately, I also suffer from incredibly Sensitive Skin. (Yes, that sensitive. Try your best to imagine.)

As in, my-skin-is-so-sensitive-that-I've used-the-same-brand-of-soap/lotion/laundry-detergent-for-TWENTY-FIVE-YEARS-sensitive.

As you can imagine, these issues tend to make summer a rough time for me--bug spray gives me a terrible, TERRIBLE rash, so throw that notion right out of your head.

I have literally tried every single flipping brand and packaging method. I've tried the sprays, the bands. I've tried the fans. I've tried avoidance. Nothing works.

What does that leave me?

That's right.

Suffering.

Favorite oil ever! ‚Äî This product is certainly my favorite oil I have ever used, as well as my fav product from Indigo Wild. F&M is such a relaxing and rejuvenating scent to have as a body oil. Those of you not familiar with Zum oil, let me give my two cents on why I'm sold on Zum for life!
The blend of oils used for Zum oil, is fantastic as well. Sweet almond, meadowfoam seed, sunflower, avocado, coconut & hemp oils make a great lube for the skin without being heavy or too thick. Great (obviously) for massage...but my fav use is for after shaving my legs. Feeling something so soothing and luxurious on my skin after a shave...well it is positively orgasmic! :)
Plus the scent is just enough to leave you feeling surrounded, but not so much that it chokes you out like some other brands I have tried.
Thanks Amazon for carrying this product!

I don't detect a scent, nor is there any tingling or anything when I apply.

These dry out my combo-oily/acne-prone/aging skin, so I must use a moisturizer after my face dries or I get that tight feeling and "pull" marks on my cheeks. These add no moisturization at all to my skin. The good news is these pads do tighten up the looks of my pores and are helping to keep acne at bay.

As long as moisturizer is used after this step, I like these.

WOW THIS PRODUCT IS THE TRUTH!!! ‚Äî So it is 2:30AM, and instead of studying for a final. I had to write this review - aka this is about to be a review you need to read. I had been putting off using this because I was hesitant that it could be an all natural polish remover and still be amazing, but I kid you not, with everything I love, this is the BEST polish remover. There are a few components that are working to its advantage. For one, as an all natural polish remover, this not only removed my polish of off my acrylics and DIDNT burn off the acrylic nail, but it managed to do ALL OF MY NAILS WITH ONE COTTON PAD! yes you read that correctly. I took off my China Glaze Agent Lavender polish with one single cotton pad. And just for reference, I timed how long it took to remove one nail - 13 seconds so multiply that by 10 fingers and my nail polish was indeed gone in just under a minute and a half. Once again with one cotton pad (this blows my mind).

The other thing working in this products favor is that it is not drying at ALL like acetone. The product almost feels like an oil. When I was removing the nail polish, I had oily residue on my hands but nothing gross or greasy feeling, it just felt like I had argan oil or cuticle oil on my fingers. This was exceptionally surprising

Decent face wash falls short on conditioning -- 2 out of 3 wasn't good enough for me ‚Äî When I started growing my beard, I already had a good moisturizing face wash and was surreptitiously "borrowing" some of my g/f's hair conditioner (the kind you put in after shampooing, leave in for a couple minutes, then rinse out), which worked reasonably well to soften my beard. I wanted to upgrade to a beard-oriented product to keep the softness and help tame fly-aways (and avoid my g/f's ire), so I decided to try this, along with adding a beard brush. As a face wash/shampoo, it's fine -- it cleans well and the smell is light and neutral (pleasantly reminds me of the old-school barbershop that cut my hair when I was a kid). However, I was very disappointed by the conditioning (or lack thereof). Even after two weeks of use, my beard just wasn't as soft, and I had more fly-aways than before. I tried washing and rinsing, as well as leaving it in for a couple of minutes before rinsing, and found no difference. As a test, I used the other conditioner again after this, and softness returned, which suggests this product doesn't have sufficient quantities of the "conditioning" ingredients and is really more of a 2-in-1 face wash/shampoo.

Ultimately I wanted to like this, but I found I get the same results with my normal (not-beard-oriented) moisturizing face wash + beard brush, as I do with this product + beard brush, at less than

slight improvement in overall skin appeared in less than a week ‚Äî So im one of those oily skin/acne prone/acne scared/and slightly wrinkled few. (Im so lucky...)

I have tried a lot of things on the market to get rid of my main most greatest skin concern, my acne scars. I was very very surprised to notice some improvement with this retinol cream. I have added a few pictures so you can see. The first picture is before the cream and the others are a few days in. I wore it under my makeup and before bed. It didn't feel heavy on my skin and absorbed rather quickly. Occasionally it made my skin feel a little itchy but it wasn't enough to bother me.

I didn't notice much difference with my acne. (I have small whiteheads rather than larger cystic acne) but it has only been a short period of time.

I use the oil pulling method with castor oil and then follow up with the cream. I use the cream twice a day and massage it in for at least 30 seconds. So far I am very pleased with the results and will continue using it. The bottle is small but I still use 2 pumps at a time so that I have enough to massage into my skin.

Great, very impressed ‚Äî I have been hesitant about purchasing an electric shaver, but I finally took the plunge on this one and have been very impressed. The unit is good to hold in your hands, it cuts without plucking, and contours to the face very well. I can shave everyday with little / no irritation (granted this is only day 2) - as opposed to a blade that I can only handle every other day. It cleans easily. You will have to experiment a little bit with direction and motion to make sure you get all the hair on your neck / chin. Take the same time as shaving with a blade, if not less, and provider equivalent shave.

trending poor reliability ‚Äî The WaterPik unit stopped working 13 months after purchase.

Q: Was this a lemon?

A: We use WaterPik nightly and we used WaterPik for over 10 years. The first one lasted 10 years and died with no symptoms. The second one lasted 3 years, and this latest third one bought in Sept. 2020 lasted 13 months.

Q: Alternatives?

A: Amazon was helpful and recommended non-Waterpik branded units. These units have powerful pump, big water tank, longer return periods, a robust worldwide voltage making the unit suited for travel, and a lower price. WaterPik is less reliable, has shorter return period, downward trending poor reliability, and costed more.

Too many negatives accumulated for WaterPik. So, we bought a new non-WaterPik unit recommended by Amazon.

Q: How is the new unit working out so far?

A: Beyond expectations.

My older kids started using regular toothpaste, and I didn't want them to have the poisons, so I ordered this again, their old favorite. After just a few months, cavities again. Tons of them. This has been a very expensive toothpaste for us. Then my older kids finally said that their teeth don't feel clean anymore. They asked for better toothpaste. Now we use Doterra. It is probably fine for people who have a super clean diet.

I ordered and received this very tightly curled ponytail and I really liked how easily it matched my 4c hair. I spent about 2 hours un-matting it and trying to recover it. After it dried it was stretched out, very little curl definition and kind of a mess. So once again I sectioned it, deep conditioned it, and put my normal defining products in it and then that was all she wrote. Completely unsalvageable. I am so disappointed. Now I do have the 2nd one but can only wear the one so I still don't have the fullness I wanted and I pretty much know that once I wash this one that'll probably be the end of it's days. So my suggestion is to use minimal product. Try to do more of a spray wash vs a full-on wash and get as much use out of it as you can.

I purchased this a little while ago and have been using it for about 2 months. It looks nice, but really only lasts about 10-15 min of shaving before you get the red flashing "charge me" indicator. Even when it is fully charged, it doesn't seem that powerful. I find myself going over an area over and over again and then just getting a regular razor to get the job done.

Pros:

Easy to turn on and off, simply press a button.

Looks good and when it works, it does a decent job.

Cons:

Lasts only 10-15 min max before you have to plug it in overnight to charge.

Does do as good of job as I thought it would actually shaving.

Recommendation:

Save you money and buy a better shaver. If if you can't afford something nicer, a bag of disposable razors will do a better job.

Best shampoo/conditioner for fine, greasy, damaged hair ‚Äî My hair is fine in texture, prone to greasiness, and a bit damaged from coloring and styling (dry, brittle, breaks easily). I have gone through so many different hair products in the last couple of years, looking for something that works well for my hair type and texture. Verb Ghost shampoo and conditioner are far and away the best products I've tried. Within just a few days, my hair was softer, smoother, and healthier-feeling. After a few weeks of use, it still feels and looks terrific.

Both the shampoo and conditioner are very light, yet surprisingly effective. The shampoo has a good, cleansing lather but doesn't feel drying. The conditioner is nice and light, and doesn't leave a greasy film on my hair. I shampoo, rinse, apply the conditioner, and let sit for a couple of minutes before rinsing. Normally, my hair will feel very heavy and difficult to rinse when I leave conditioner on for that long, but this rinses out cleanly yet still feels soft and well conditioned. You also need a surprisingly small amount of product -- they are super effective. My hair is definitely clean all day and doesn't get greasy by nighttime; the next morning, it's often still clean enough that I can throw it in a bun until the afternoon before really feeling the need to wash it again. I am also shedding far less hair with each wash than I have in years.
